article_text:
Well, that must have polled badly. The White House on Tuesday dropped its proposal to tax 529 education savings accounts, a week after President Obama floated the idea in the State of Union. This is a cut-their-losses move, but we wish the idea had rotted in the sun for a few more months. It would have been instructive to the same middle-class taxpayers Mr. Obama claims to serve.

Mr. Obama wanted to tax 529 plans to finance a more targeted college subsidy program that politicians could better control. The 529 plans put...

twitter.description: But the middle-class should realize they’re where the money is, the Wall Street Journal writes in an editorial.
twitter.title: Obama’s 529 Surrender

Mr. Obama wanted to tax 529 plans to finance a more targeted college subsidy program that politicians could better control.
The 529 plans put...
The White House on Tuesday dropped its proposal to tax 529 education savings accounts, a week after President Obama floated the idea in the State of Union.
This is a cut-their-losses move, but we wish the idea had rotted in the sun for a few more months.
It would have been instructive to the same middle-class taxpayers Mr. Obama claims to serve.
